>So said ok_lilya on 2003-06-18 --------------------
>Hello,
>
>I have a qu=
estion or more of a problem.
>Does JUnit run outside of Visual Age for Java=
?

Certainly it does.

>It runs perfectly in my VAJava, but when I export i=
t and run in 
>command prompt, it doesn't run. After days of debugging I've=
 finally 
>pin-pointed the problem. It's because the method inVAJava() thro=
ws a 
>LinkageError (Throwable) upon executing this line: 
>Class.forName("=
com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport"); and therefore 
>doesn't return true, whic=
h makes the application stall. How do I know 
>for sure that it doesn't sta=
ll because of a different problem? Well, 
>if I comment out that line inVAJ=
ava() returns true, and continues to 
>execute normally outside of VAJ. How=
ever, my goal is to have it 
>running without making any changes to the JUn=
it.

Don't export JUnit from VAJ. Instead, download a fresh JUnit and use i=
t outside VAJ to your heart's content.

Take care.
